meanings.definition: The quality of being able to adjust to new conditions or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: Her adaptability to different situations impressed her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The team's success was due to their adaptability to changing circumstances.
meanings.sent3: His adaptability to unexpected challenges always brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The adaptability of a chameleon is often compared to her ability to blend in effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The adaptability of a Swiss Army knife makes it a useful tool in various situations.

meanings.definition: The ability to change or be changed in order to fit or work better in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: The adaptability of the software allowed it to be customized for different users.
meanings.sent2: In nature, the adaptability of species determines their survival in changing environments.
meanings.sent3: The adaptability of the puzzle pieces made it fun to create unique shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her adaptability in problem-solving was like a key that could unlock any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The adaptability of the fabric made it perfect for various weather conditions.

meanings.definition: The capacity to be modified for a new use or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The adaptability of the tool made it versatile for different tasks.
meanings.sent2: The adaptability of the design allowed for easy customization.
meanings.sent3: His adaptability in repurposing old items into new creations was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent4: The adaptability of the building's layout made it suitable for various events.
meanings.sent5: The adaptability of the material enabled it to be used in innovative ways.
